FEATURE.label: HPA001012 Normal tissue immunohistochemistry summary
FEATURE.NOTE: Lymphoid tissues showed moderate to strong cytoplasmic positivity. Remaining normal cells were generally negative.
Two (or more) antibodies yielding similar staining patterns which are consistent with available gene/protein characterization data
FEATURE.LINK: Immunohistochemical staining of human lymph node shows strong cytoplasmic positivity in lymphoid cells outside reaction centra.

FEATURE.label: HPA001083 Normal tissue immunohistochemistry summary
FEATURE.NOTE: Lymphoid tissues showed moderate to strong cytoplasmic positivity. Remaining normal cells were generally negative.
Two (or more) antibodies yielding similar staining patterns which are consistent with available gene/protein characterization data
FEATURE.LINK: Immunohistochemical staining of human spleen shows strong cytoplasmic positivity in cells in red pulp and cells in white pulp.

FEATURE.label: HPA001012 Cancer tissue immunohistochemistry summary
FEATURE.NOTE: Malignant lymphomas and cases of colorectal, melanomas, ovarian and cervical cancers showed moderate to strong cytoplasmic positivity. Remaining malignancies were weakly stained or negative.
Two (or more) antibodies yielding similar staining patterns which are consistent with available gene/protein characterization data

FEATURE.label: HPA001083 Cancer tissue immunohistochemistry summary
FEATURE.NOTE: Malignant lymphomas and cases of colorectal, melanomas, ovarian and ovarian cancers showed moderate to strong cytoplasmic positivity. Remaining malignancies were weakly stained or negative.
Two (or more) antibodies yielding similar staining patterns which are consistent with available gene/protein characterization data

FEATURE.label: HPA001083 Cell line immunofluorescence summary
FEATURE.NOTE: Staining of focal adhesions, nucleus and cytoplasm in A-431 and U-2 OS.
The subcellular location is supported by literature.
Main location(s):Nucleus but not nucleoli,Cytoplasm,Focal Adhesions
FEATURE.LINK: Immunofluorescent staining of human cell line U-2 OS shows positivity in nucleus but not nucleoli, cytoplasm & focal adhesions.
